intro: Urostigma maximilianum, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its flowers are usually arranged in umbels and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
